History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient has been feeling down and withdrawn, experiencing difficulty concentrating and a loss of interest in activities. They were diagnosed with depression about one to two years ago and sought help when symptoms became overwhelming.
Medical and Psychiatric History: The patient has a history of depression diagnosed approximately one to two years ago.
Psychosocial History: The patient is originally from India and has lived in Los Angeles for about twenty years. They have a close relationship with their parents but have disagreements with their brother regarding family matters. They appreciate the diversity of Los Angeles and enjoy the entertainment industry.
Mental Health Observations: The patient demonstrates good control over their temper, even when irritated.
Physiological Observations: The patient reports difficulty sleeping, taking up to two hours on some nights to fall asleep, but has been able to sleep within half an hour recently. They experienced sleep issues three days ago.
Current Functional Status: The patient travels back to their hometown every three to four years and engages in various activities for relaxation, including cooking, watching movies, and socializing.
Diagnostic Impressions: The patient has a diagnosis of depression, which has been managed through yoga and meditation instead of medication.
Progress Evaluation: The patient has made progress in managing their symptoms through alternative therapeutic interventions like yoga and meditation.
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient has been practicing yoga and meditation for about a year, which has significantly helped their mental health.
